title: ONT HPNA CONFIGURATION COMMAND
description: This command allows the operator to modify ONT HPNA port provisioning data.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with equipment privileges, and 
executed by operators with equipment privileges.
syntax: > configure hpna ont (uni-idx) [ cust-info <Gpon::CustomerInfo> ] [ no pwr-override | pwr-override <Gpon::OntPwrShedState> ] [ no master-mode | master-mode <Gpon::HpnaMasterSelect> ] [ no admin-state | admin-state <Gpon::ItfAdminStatus> ]

resource_parameters.name: (uni-idx)
resource_parameters.description: identification of the hpna interface index

command_parameters.name: cust-info
command_parameters.description: information for HPNA port optional parameter - char string - length: x<=80

command_parameters.name: [no] pwr-override
command_parameters.description: power settings to be included for data class power shedding optional parameter with default value: "disabled"

command_parameters.name: [no] master-mode
command_parameters.description: master mode of HPNA mac optional parameter with default value: "default"

command_parameters.name: [no] admin-state
command_parameters.description: administrative status of the interface optional parameter with default value: "down" Table "ONT HPNA Configuration Command" Display Parameters Specific Information:
values: up                    : set the admin-state to up
down                  : set the admin-state to down

command_parameters.name: base-mac-address
command_parameters.description: base mac address This element is always shown. - a mac-address (example : 01:02:03:04:05:06) (L2 only) - length: 6

command_parameters.name: port-configuration
command_parameters.description: configuration status of hpna uni This element is always shown. ( unknown | coax_12_28 | phone_12_28 )
values: unknown               : cant reach the ont or the ont didnt return a response to the query

command_parameters.name: oper-state
command_parameters.description: the operational state of the interface This element is always shown. ( up | down | testing | unknown | dormant | no-value )
values: no-value              : no entry in the table

raw:
help configure hpna ont
ONT HPNA CONFIGURATION COMMAND
==============================

Command Description
-------------------

This command allows the operator to modify ONT HPNA port provisioning data.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with equipment privileges, and 
executed by operators with equipment privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure hpna ont (uni-idx) [ cust-info <Gpon::CustomerInfo> ] [ no 
pwr-override | pwr-override <Gpon::OntPwrShedState> ] [ no master-mode | 
master-mode <Gpon::HpnaMasterSelect> ] [ no admin-state | admin-state 
<Gpon::ItfAdminStatus> ]

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "ONT HPNA Configuration Command" Resource Parameters

Resource Identifier        Description

(uni-idx)                  identification of the hpna interface index

Table "ONT HPNA Configuration Command" Command Parameters

Parameter                  Description

cust-info                  information for HPNA port
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::CustomerInfo>
                           Format:
                           - char string
                           - length: x<=80 

[no] pwr-override          power settings to be included for data class power 
shedding
                           optional parameter with default value: "disabled"

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::OntPwrShedState>
                           Format:
                           ( enabled
                           | disabled )
                           Possible values:
                           - enabled               : enabled
                           - disabled              : disabled

[no] master-mode           master mode of HPNA mac
                           optional parameter with default value: "default"

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::HpnaMasterSelect>
                           Format:
                           ( default
                           | auto
                           | forced )
                           Possible values:
                           - default               : default master mode
                           - auto                  : auto master mode
                           - forced                : forced master mode

[no] admin-state           administrative status of the interface
                           optional parameter with default value: "down"

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::ItfAdminStatus>
                           Format:
                           ( up
                           | down )
                           Possible values:
                           - up                    : set the admin-state to up
                           - down                  : set the admin-state to down


Table "ONT HPNA Configuration Command" Display Parameters

Specific Information:

Parameter                  Description

 base-mac-address          base mac address
                           This element is always shown.

                           parameter type: <Ces::DestMacAddress>
                           - a mac-address (example : 01:02:03:04:05:06) (L2 
only)
                           - length: 6 

 port-configuration        configuration status of hpna uni
                           This element is always shown.

                           parameter type: <Gpon::HpnaConfigStatus>
                           ( unknown
                           | coax_12_28
                           | phone_12_28 )
                           Possible values:
                           - unknown               : cant reach the ont or the 
ont didnt return a response to the query
                           - coax_12_28            : not supported
                           - phone_12_28           : not supported

 oper-state                the operational state of the interface
                           This element is always shown.

                           parameter type: <Itf::ifOperStatus>
                           ( up
                           | down
                           | testing
                           | unknown
                           | dormant
                           | no-value )
                           Possible values:
                           - up                    : up,traffic can pass
                           - down                  : down,no traffic is passing
                           - testing               : testing,no traffic is 
passing
                           - unknown               : unknown
                           - dormant               : dormant,no traffic is 
passing
                           - no-value              : no entry in the table

DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#
